name: Melia Barcelona Sky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel. But you do get the fealing that they are trying a little too hard to be too cool for school. Good secure car parking imediately adjacent to the hotel - not too expensive at €25 for the 1 day / night that we were there. check in staff all very nice and helpful and rooms again were nice and bright. We were on the 12th floor looking out over the outdoor pool (on the 6th floor) and sea beyond (and I mean beyond.)
reviews.title: Good...but more form over function again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tiny gym - nice equipment but not much of it and also the air con in the gym wasnt working with predictable noxious results!
reviews.title: Trendy and Futuristic!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other comments re the noise from the nightclub are spot on. Make sure you are on as high a floor as possible away from the pool if you want to sleep. Its clearly a very popular nightclub right now and was heaing all night until 5am.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, what I'd expect from the ME, but with some drawbacks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didnt go to the nightclub but we did have cocktails in the bar downstairs. One was very nice - one was hopelessly made.
reviews.title: OK hotel, poor location, poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary its nice - but would I stay again? Probably not. If spending this much I'd spend a little more and stay at Mandarin Oriental or W Hotel.
reviews.title: Give it 6 stars

reviews.text: Yes this is a wonderful triumph of design... No question.....
reviews.title: Bit of a Mixture

reviews.title: Breathtaking Views, Fantastic Position and Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restuarant on 24th let me sit in the bar and not serve me for 15 minutes... so I left.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: Prawn tempura took 45 minutes to prepare when I eventually sat down to dinner
reviews.title: Tries to hard and fails on too many points.

reviews.text: Me and my mother booked a weekend trip to Barcelona in april 2010.
reviews.title: One of the best I've stayed in

reviews.text: The hotel is very fresh and hip. The room was very clean and sound proof. I have never slept better in any hotel! The staff was very helpful, gave us map and answered all our silly questions about Barcelona :)
reviews.title: A nice alternative in Barcelona!

reviews.text: It's not located in central Barcelona, like Las Ramblas, but hey, who wants to live there?! This hotel is located just a few minutes from the Metro station of Poble Nou, and from there its like 10 mins ride to central tourist location. Otherwise, you could just walk down Av Diagonal to the city, or take the tram that stops right outside the hotel.
reviews.title: I have never experienced something better

reviews.text: The hotel has gym and SPA facilities (like Sauna, pool, hamam), which we used everyday (free of charge, lovely!)
reviews.title: So so, but view is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You really have to try this hotel!
reviews.title: simply the best

reviews.text: Takes a bit of getting to, but worth it. Amazing views from higher rooms and great design.
reviews.title: Stunning inside and out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please, please don't listen to the previous review saying this place wasn't fabulous. It was one of the best hotels both myself and my boyfriend had ever stayed in. We got a bargain through TravelZoo and what with the excellent unlimited breakfast costing 22EUR if you didn't get a deal, it worked out at only 65 EUR each for 2 nights.
reviews.title: an absolute bargain and one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in
Trendy, chic, but not the most comfortable
reviews.text: The breakfast was outstanding - cava, red and white wine, Nespresso Coffee, hot chocolate, and that was just the drinks! You could enjoy fresh bread with the local tomato salsa, Iberico ham, mini pizzas, mini pancakes with dulce de leche, fresh fruit, cereal, yoghurts, doughnuts, apple tart, smoked salmon, pate, need I go on?! Delicious, fresh and tasty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was without question the most comfortable we have both ever slept in. They even had a "pillow menu" for you to select the exact type you wanted (we didn't try this). The view was incredible too over the city and you could see the Sagrada Famila (or the sea, depending on the direction!). The location at first seemed further out than we'd normally stay for a city break, but we hopped on the yellow line and got to Plaza Catalunya within 15 minutes effortlessly. The metro was frequent, fast, clean and also very cheap - 10 journeys for 8 EUR. I have stayed in a hotel right off La Rambla before and it was hot, uncomfortable and noisy. The Poblenou area is peaceful, residential and very very authentic.
reviews.title: ME is the one for me!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Enjoyed every minute and this great hotel

description: Architecture that staircases the sky; a beacon watching over an energetic cityscape-ME Barcelona Hotel offers a new interpretation to contemporary design, international cuisine, and the urban experience; fusing personal and professional into one emblematic hotel!
